content.description: Sea Of The Beast is one of the first lines established at the area and still is one of the best. Start standing on a flat jug in the middle of the face. Move left then up via a huge move to a sloper at the lip, then mantel precariously onto the slab above, either going left, or straight up (more direct).
content.protection: A few pads. It has a flat landing but is fairly tall....
content.location: On the upvalley side of the boulder, SOTB is the obvious line in the middle of the mostly blank face. In early season months, the stream underneath the line may cause wet pad problems.

content.description:
Like

Sea Of The Beast

, Scattered Lines is an awesome moderate with perfect rock. SDS on a tongue/rail feature, then move up and right to a few small crimps to set up for a big, right hand move to a nice edge. Finish with lots of tension and weird body position on more awesome crimps.
content.protection: A few pads. It has a pretty good landing.
content.location: Located on the cave side of Boulder #1, it starts to the right of the weird black pyrite features (aka the scattered lines) then works up and back left following the perfect line of crimps.

content.description:
Monster from the Deep is a nice testpiece on fine rock with some very cool holds. Begin sitting on the arete using a pair of edges, the left hand hold being better than the right. Move left to a sweet slot crimp, then make interesting moves along the arete until connecting with

Sea of the Beast

at its slippery mantel.

This is an amazing problem, one which Iâ€™d give 4 stars if not for the possibility of topping out after the first move, although this would be a completely different line still.
content.protection: A few pads and maybe a tarp for the stream under the start.
content.location:
On the west face of Boulder #1, it climbs basically the entirety of the left arete/lip. Finish on

Sea of the Beast

.
